resource.name: Municipal Property Tax Rates
resource.description: The dataset is a list of property tax rates that are applicable in each municipality in the Province. These rates are applied to property assessment (based on market value) which can change from year to year. The convention is to express the tax rate as per $100 of assessment e.g., Amherst's residential rate is $1.63 per $100 of assessment.

domain_metadata.value: This information has been gathered from Statement of Estimate Reports as submitted to the Province by municipalities. The municipalities are required to submit this informaiton to the Province by Sepember 30th of each year.  Municipalities may also have additional area rates for special services on top of the general rate. Users are cautioned these tax rates are for general reference only, for official rates please contact the appropriate Municipality.   The Cape Breton Suburban rate is an average of 8 various rural suburban tax rates within the county of Cape Breton.    Effective April 1st, 2020, the Town of Windsor and the Municipality of West Hants have consolidated into a regional municipality, West Hants Regional Municipality.
Annually from each fiscal year, from 09-10 to 20-21 (April 1, 2009 to March 31, 2021)
